# Mix Blend Mode

## Usage

For detailed instructions, please consult the Tailwind CSS documentation.

## Compatibility

| Class                          | Support     |
| ------------------------------ | ----------- |
| `mix-blend-normal`             | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-multiply`           | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-screen`             | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-overlay`            | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-darken`             | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-lighten`            | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-color-dodge`        | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-color-burn`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-hard-light`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-soft-light`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-difference`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-exclusion`          | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-hue`                | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-saturation`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-color`              | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-luminosity`         | ğŸŒ Web only |
| `mix-blend-plus-lighter`       | ğŸŒ Web only |
